Comment: During the Nazi era, the SA (Sturmabteilung), a paramilitary organization, targeted and intimidated judges who were perceived as being critical of the Nazi regime or who were Jewish. This was part of a broader pattern of the Nazis silencing opposition and establishing control over the legal system. Judges who resisted were often forced to retire or were removed from their positions.
